intro: Hymenodictyon kurria var. bequaertii, commonly known as the Kurria variety, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and has elliptical, glossy leaves with a dark green hue. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in cymes. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
